{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3448128,"name":"gcschmit","username":"gcschmit","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/gcschmit/{size}/5380_2.png","created_at":"2024-11-15T21:26:35.338Z","cooked":"

What is the recommended setup for at home practice with two robots with the VH-109? We want to use the VH-109 WiFi 6E. The docs are clear how to use two VH-109, one as an access point, to achieve this. However, if we have a second robot, with a third VH-109, I don’t see how this approach scales to support multiple robots. Is our only option to convert a VH-109 to a VH-113 and configure a managed switch? We aren’t opposed to doing this, but I’d rather avoid the complexity. Suggestions?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2024-11-15T21:26:35.338Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":261,"reads":352,"readers_count":351,"score":1420.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":474978,"topic_slug":"vh-109-access-point-for-multiple-robots","display_username":"gcschmit","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://frc-radio.vivid-hosting.net/getting-started/usage/practicing-at-home","internal":false,"reflection":false,"clicks":22}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":15922,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FRC 3061 Lead Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/vh-109-access-point-for-multiple-robots/474978/1","custom_user_title":"FRC 3061 Lead Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true,"can_vote":false},{"id":3448133,"name":"Tauseef Afraz","username":"TFM110","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tfm110/{size}/197758_2.png","created_at":"2024-11-15T21:33:16.103Z","cooked":"
frc-radio.vivid-hosting.net

Practicing At Home | FIRST FRC Radio

Your best option maybe to use a VH-109 and convert it to a AP, or a VH-113 if you grab one when they become available. I don’t think it will be too complex to set up. If anything, you could contact VIVID HOSTING if you have any question on setting it up.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2024-11-15T21:33:16.103Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":5,"reads":331,"readers_count":330,"score":91.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":474978,"topic_slug":"vh-109-access-point-for-multiple-robots","display_username":"Tauseef Afraz","primary_group_name":"Swyft-Robotics","flair_name":"FUN","flair_url":"/uploads/default/original/3X/3/5/3523e759b0af37a7757142a8b2aa79b31f1a47c4.png","flair_bg_color":"","flair_color":"","flair_group_id":60,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://frc-radio.vivid-hosting.net/getting-started/usage/practicing-at-home#vh-109-full-field","internal":false,"reflection":false,"clicks":23}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":39084,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FRC5431AM | FRC5790M| FUN | SWYFT"},"post_url":"/t/vh-109-access-point-for-multiple-robots/474978/2","custom_user_title":"FRC5431AM | FRC5790M| FUN | SWYFT","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3448149,"name":"Fletcher","username":"FletcherS7","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/fletchers7/{size}/168995_2.png","created_at":"2024-11-15T22:02:39.702Z","cooked":"

If you don’t want to buy a 4th VH-109 then yes you would need a VH-109/VH-113 running the access point firmware.

This would also require a managed switch connected to the access point.
(This TP-Link for example: https://www.amazon.com/dp/B00K4DS5KU)

Unless you have computers capable of connecting to 6GHz wireless, then you can connect them to the SSID being broadcast by the access point, removing the need for the switch.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2024-11-15T22:02:39.702Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":286,"readers_count":285,"score":92.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":474978,"topic_slug":"vh-109-access-point-for-multiple-robots","display_username":"Fletcher","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.amazon.com/dp/B00K4DS5KU","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Amazon.com: TP-Link 8 Port Gigabit Switch | Easy Smart Managed | Plug & Play | Desktop/Wall-Mount | Sturdy Metal w/ Shielded Ports | Support QoS, Vlan, IGMP and LAG (TL-SG108E) : Electronics","clicks":39}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":25039,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FIRST California | FTAA, CSA, A/V, and everything between."},"post_url":"/t/vh-109-access-point-for-multiple-robots/474978/3","custom_user_title":"FIRST California | FTAA, CSA, A/V, and everything between.","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":true,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3448169,"name":"Bob Bell","username":"rjbell4","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/r/8c91f0/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-11-16T00:01:13.303Z","cooked":"
FletcherS7:

Unless you have computers capable of connecting to 6GHz wireless, then you can connect them to the SSID being broadcast by the access point, removing the need for the switch.

FWIW, we haven’t yet connected a second robot to our radio (we still just have the one robot!), but we did connect a second computer to our VH-109 running the regular firmware in AP mode using one of these Wi-Fi 6E USB adapters: https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B0D4PL4FQM/

I just wanted to share that that was successful, in case anyone else is searching for a USB adapter to add compatible Wi-Fi to laptop.

That’s good news. I bought a cheaper adapter from Amazon and it didn’t work reliably at all.

So, if I use a VH-113, and connect it to a managed switch as the docs indicate.

I guess my questions revolve around how the managed switch is configured. The example doesn’t indicate which VLAN should be used for the driver’s station. Is it in VLAN 100? I’m basing that off Cheesy-Arena switch config

Is the Full Field diagram the better solution? (Which still doesn’t really indicate where the FMS should be located)

Is it critical to isolate the VLANs from each other (as Cheesy Arena’s example does)? The switch I grabbed doesn’t support ACL’s as it’s just a basic L2 switch.

Can multiple robots be in the same VLAN? (I’m just envisioning a scenario where we only have one driver station rigged up, but will want to have multiple robots)

mpking:

The example doesn’t indicate which VLAN should be used for the driver’s station.

If you scroll down a bit more, it tells you what VLANs each driver station should be

Thank you so much. So many of the questions I have are asked in the thread (conveniently linked in the doc) that spawned the document.)

I’m wondering if Home FMS? should be stickyed or something for a little bit. Lots of people are going to be looking for this information in the next 7-14 days (unless your one of the RI3D crew)

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2025-01-03T23:52:57.940Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":86,"readers_count":85,"score":17.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":474978,"topic_slug":"vh-109-access-point-for-multiple-robots","display_username":"mpking","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/home-fms/475559","internal":true,"reflection":false,"title":"Home FMS?","clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":52686,"username":"DavidMasin","name":"David","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/davidmasin/{size}/205339_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":99,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/vh-109-access-point-for-multiple-robots/474978/9","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3468263,"name":"Fletcher","username":"FletcherS7","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/fletchers7/{size}/168995_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-04T03:49:04.400Z","cooked":"
mpking:

The example doesn’t indicate which VLAN should be used for the driver’s station.

It does!

You can also change this in the config page on the VH-109/113 .

mpking:

Is the Full Field diagram the better solution? (Which still doesn’t really indicate where the FMS should be located)

FMS / ADMIN VLAN should be located on whatever you define as the native VLAN on the trunk port (and cannot be one of the DS ports)
VLAN 100 is what is used on the official field, but you can use any VLAN number.

mpking:

Is it critical to isolate the VLANs from each other (as Cheesy Arena’s example does)?

You’ll need to isolate the VLANs from each other if want to connect to multiple robots.

mpking:

The switch I grabbed doesn’t support ACL’s as it’s just a basic L2 switch.

The ACL’s are only needed if you are routing traffic from the DS VLAN to another VLAN.

mpking:

Can multiple robots be in the same VLAN? (I’m just envisioning a scenario where we only have one driver station rigged up, but will want to have multiple robots)

Sort answer no.
Long answer, kinda but it’s complicated and you can’t do it with just a VH-109/113
I would advise against trying to do.
